intro: Brunellia boliviana var. brittonii, commonly known as the Bolivian sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland and montane forests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
